title: Borrow checking time regression from stable to nightly

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
The compile time for the following code has increased significantly since the last stable:
```rust
extern crate futures;
use futures::{future, IntoFuture, Future};
fn main() {
    let t: std::result::Result<(), ()> = Ok(());
    let f = t
            .into_future()
            .and_then(|_| future::ok(()))
            .and_then(|_| future::ok(()))
            .and_then(|_| future::ok(()))
            .and_then(|_| future::ok(()))
            .and_then(|_| future::ok(()))
            .and_then(|_| future::ok(()))
            .and_then(|_| future::ok(()))
            .and_then(|_| future::ok(()))
            .and_then(|_| future::ok(()))
            .and_then(|_| future::ok(()))
            .and_then(|_| future::ok(()))
            .and_then(|_| future::ok(()))
            .and_then(|_| future::ok(()))
            .and_then(|_| future::ok(()));
    f.wait();
}
```
Ignoring the fact that the `translation`phase takes forever (tracked in #38528), the `borrow checking` phase now takes orders of magnitude longer than on the last stable:
```console
$ cargo +stable rustc -- -Z time-passes | grep "borrow checking"
time: 0.000; rss: 88MB  borrow checking                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      $ cargo +nightly rustc -- -Z time-passes | grep "borrow checking"
time: 1.173; rss: 101MB borrow checking
```
